thread.title: Tolley fumbling and in the dark over LSV - NZ First
thread.title_full: Tolley fumbling and in the dark over LSV - NZ First

author: Fuseworks Media
title: Tolley fumbling and in the dark over LSV - NZ First
text:
Thursday, 22 October, 2015 - 17:33 
The government is inventing excuses to close the successful Limited Service Volunteer programme, says New Zealand First. 
Minister for Social Development Anne Tolley claims there is a drop off in youth unemployment, but the data shows this is incorrect, says New Zealand First Spokesperson for Social Development Darroch Ball. 
"The official information we have shows that the government intends to shut down the programme. 
"The Minister of Defence, Gerry Brownlee, objected in Parliament today to the tabling of the documents which prove the accuracy of this statement. 
"Mrs Tolley has no reason to close the programme. 
"She claims that the programme at the Trentham base was closed because of lack of demand. However, we have established it was because a five-year lease ended in January this year and the building was sold in June. 
"The Auckland-based programme is moving to a temporary site in a scout hall. The Defence Force plans to close it in 2017. 
"The Minister was caught in an embarrassing situation today in Parliament when she did not have any of this information yet the programme is from the Ministry she has responsibility for. 
"The Minister insists that only 800 of almost 25,000 unemployed youth would be suitable for this course - which is a ludicrous and unprovable claim," says Mr Ball. 
"Minister Tolley needs to increase places on the LSV programme and stop any further unjustified cost cutting to continue."
